meanings.sent1: The loyal dog was watchdogging the house while the family was away.
meanings.sent2: The security guard was watchdogging the premises to ensure no intruders entered.
meanings.sent3: The vigilant squirrel was watchdogging the bird feeder to protect its precious nuts.
meanings.sent4: The wise owl was watchdogging the forest, keeping a keen eye on all the creatures below.
meanings.sent5: The diligent student was watchdogging the library, making sure all books were in their proper place.

meanings.definition: The act of monitoring or overseeing closely
meanings.sent1: The watchdogging of the project progress helped ensure everything stayed on track.
meanings.sent2: The constant watchdogging of the children at the playground prevented any accidents.
meanings.sent3: The intense watchdogging of the cookie jar by the kids led to suspicions of a midnight snack.
meanings.sent4: The meticulous watchdogging of the budget saved the company from financial troubles.
meanings.sent5: The thorough watchdogging of the construction site prevented any safety hazards.
